summary: Sorbet type checker is creating duplicate singleton methods on Temporal workflow definition classes, causing a RuntimeError. The issue occurs when using Sorbet runtime decorators on handler methods, and has been resolved in recent Sorbet releases.
userImpact: Users employing Sorbet for type checking encounter runtime errors that prevent workflow definitions with signal handlers from loading.
rootCause: Sorbet runtime adds singleton methods when decorating instance methods, conflicting with Temporal's own singleton method handling in the Definition class.
proposedFix: Detect when Sorbet is adding a method and ignore it, or await fixes in Sorbet that prevent duplicate singleton method creation.
resolutionDetails: Resolved in recent Sorbet releases (sorbet/sorbet#8592 and sorbet/sorbet#9084 were fixed upstream)
keyQuote: Attempting to override Temporal-defined class definition method (RuntimeError)
